Cory in the House is a television show, which aired on the Disney Channel from January 12, 2007 to September 12, 2008 and was a spin-off from the Disney show That's So Raven. The show focuses on Cory Baxter, who moves from San Francisco, California to Washington, D.C. with his father, after Victor Baxter gets a new job in the White House as the official head chef. The series marks a Disney Channel first, as it is the channel's first spin-off. This is also the only Disney Channel spin-off series to be broadcast in standard definition for the entire length of the show. Reruns of the series have not been produced on Disney Channel, or on Disney XD; however they continue to air on the Family channel in Canada. Raven-Symon√© guest-starred, reprising her role as Raven Baxter in one episode. In 2014 Disney Channel started airing a weekly block called Disney Replay on Wednesdays nights, during which episodes of Cory in the House air alongside That's So Raven and Kim Possible, among others.

Brilliant singleplayer version of Counter-Strike if you're the kind of person that enjoys missions from back in the day where you didn't have to 'pay to win' (or look cool) and receive just the satisfaction of beating a game rather than selling a 5 cent case you earned thinking it was actually worth your time.

One niggle I have however is that the bots are pretty useless half the time, especially as the game pretty much depends on them entirely unless you're an expert player that can win 1v6 almost every round.

Counter-Strike: Condition Zero


Acerca del juego:

Esta versi√≥n de Counter-Strike trae una extensa campa√±a Tour of Duty, un n√∫mero casi ilimitado de escaramuzas, actualizaciones y nuevos contenidos para la modalidad multijugador, que ya ha recibido varios premios. Adem√°s, disfrutar√°s de m√°s de 12 misiones para un solo jugador de regalo. Counter-Strike: Condition Zero es toda una gozada tanto si juegas solo como si juegas con tus colegas.

La historia del lanzamiento de Counter Strike Condition Zero (A partir de ahora CZ) ha sido lo m√°s parecido a un culebr√≥n. Un juego que en estas l√≠neas avanz√°bamos hace ya casi dos a√±os, y que en un principio desarrollaba la compa√±√≠a GearBox al fin ve la luz en nuestro pa√≠s pero desarrollado por Turtle Rock. Para muchos la espera ha sido demasiada larga, y quiz√°s para la mayor√≠a ha llegado tarde, muy tarde.

Counter-Strike: Condition Zero Counter Strike es un mito en el mundo de los videojuegos, cualquier aficionado al menos lo ha visto funcionando y muchos al menos lo han probado. Este Mod del Half Life ideado por aficionados ha llegado a ser el juego m√°s jugado de Internet durante largos a√±os. No hab√≠a cibercaf√© sin que Counter Strike se encontrarse instalado en sus equipos, ni portal de juegos que no albergara servidores destinados para este juego online.
Valve al ver la popularidad que rodeaba a este Mod fue apoyando paulatinamente cada vez m√°s al equipo que lo ideo a sacar nuevas versiones, ya que indirectamente al necesitar una copia Half Life instalada en el PC para hacerlo funcionar, consegu√≠an que este otro m√≠tico FPS siguiera vendiendo m√°s y m√°s.


Counter-Strike: Condition Zero Finalmente Valve decidi√≥ realizar una versi√≥n comercial completa actualiz√°ndolo y convirti√©ndolo en un juego autosuficiente, pero aqu√≠ es donde comenz√≥ el principio del fin. El t√≠tulo que en un principio se iba a encargar Rogue Entertainment dej√≥ el proyecto tras desarrollar un prototipo que no convenci√≥ a Valve. En agosto del 2001 esta ¬ëpatata caliente' lleg√≥ a las manos de Gearbox Software, un estudio estrechamente relacionado con Valve pero que finalmente en Julio del 2002 abandon√≥ el proyecto.


Counter-Strike: Condition Zero A finales del a√±o 2002 cuando CZ parec√≠a estancado, Ritual Entertainment se hace cargo de √©l, finalmente parec√≠a que finalmente alguien se iba a encargar de acabarlo y presentarlo al p√∫blico. Pero como una historia que no parece tener fin, el juego se retrasaba m√°s y la gente empieza a preguntarse cuando aparecera este Mod reformado del Half Life.

procesador de 800 MHz, 128 MB de RAM, tarjeta de v√≠deo de 32 MB, Windows XP, rat√≥n, teclado y conexi√≥n a Internet

Counter Strike Condition Zero is an interesting game to discuss not because of it's merits as a game but largely for it's history. It had a surprisingly troubled development and changed hands between 4 distinctive developers before finally becoming finished. 

The game was originally designed by Rogue, the developers behind Strife and American McGee's Alice. However the developer went out of buisiness so Valve instead gave it to Gearbox, who Valve had previously worked with on Opposing Force and Blue Shift. Much of the game is based around Gearbox's version, which focused on creating more impressive graphics and remaking many of the classic Counter Strike maps in better detail.

However, the project changed hands again and the game was handed off to Ritual entertainment. The guys behind SiN. They remade the game as a pseudo singleplayer title before Valve decided to hand the game off to Turtlerock studios. Who would years later create Left 4 Dead. Who finished the game and completed it based on Gearbox's version. The content Ritual made would be released as the "Deleted scenes".

The final game is very much inspired by Counter Strike 1.6. It plays very similarly albiet with nicer graphics and a very different art style. It was also the very first Counter Strike game to ship with bots by default. The game also contains a singleplayer separate from the Deleted Scenes, however this is just an Unreal Tournament style ladder featuring botmatches. 

When Condition Zero came out, it was seen as outdated. It released two years too late, and the very same year as Valve's own Counter Strike Source. As a result it isn't often talked about when compared to the other games. Since you do get it by default when buying 1.6 it's interesting to play for curiosity's sake, but you'll likely find more players for 1.6 or Source.

This game actually has better bots than the latest iteration of this game series, good graphics that is reminiscent of CS 1.6, a nice game which actually isn't affected by nerfs or buffs, which is nice, most modern computers should run this game, it's still very dark in certain parts of maps (a well known one being lower tunnels leading to B palace or CT mid on Dust 2), this does offer single player missions so if you want a game of CS without the graphics but with the nostalgia, CS:CZ is one of the games you should play. If you buy this game, you get CS:CZ, CS 1.6 and the "Deleted Scenes" version of this game, for the price of CS 1.6 alone, which is a nice bonus and one of the better reasons to buy this game if you want empty servers and bad graphics, but it's nice to relive CS 1.6 again.

Description : dans Counter-Strike : Condition Zero vous aurez acc√®s au mode multijoueur de CSCZ ainsi qu'√† des missions en solo, uniques dans Counter-Strike. Il n'y a pas d'histoires, juste des parties contre des bots avec des objectifs comme faire un certain nombre d'√©liminations avec telle arme, ou remprter une manche en moins de X secondes. Loin d'√™tre incontournable, il reste agr√©able √† jouer et il plaira aux grands fans de la s√©rie.

Si no dispones de un buen internet, o de amigos para jugar al Counter Strike 1.6, o si quieres mejorar en fps, comprate este juego porque te lo pasaras bien, ademas al principio es facil, pero poco a poco la dificultad va aumentando hasta un punto en el que es casi imposible matar a los BOTS. Tard√© 20 horas en terminarlo y la unica pega que le voy a dar es que hay 4 campa√±as: facil, normal, dificil y experto, bien, la pega es que los mapas se repiten todo el rato, hay 18 mapas diferentes en 1 campa√±a, pero estos se repiten en las 4 y ya aburre.

El unico Counter-Strike que tiene modo historia y en mi opinion, es uno de los mejores juegos que he jugado!

Me gusta la historia aunque sea algo pobre, no me gusto mucho que pusieran acentos rusos, ingleses y otros mas al espaol, hubiera sido mejor ponerlas en espa√±ol latino o espa√±ol espa√±a, ya que aveces dicen unos dialogos que por el acento no entendia, pero todo bien. Juegos como estos merecen un buen Remake. (me refiero al Deleted Scenes)

En lo que es la historia, cuenta como los grupos anti terroristas del mundo batallan contra las fuerzas terroritas que pretenden causar caos a nivel mundial (algo que vivimos hoy en dia lamentblemente) y eso le a√±ade su toque de realismo a la actualidad.

Ojala a√±adieran un modo historia al CSGO. seria emocionante.

En musica, bueno es buena y combina con el juego.

El Deleted Scenes dura unas buenas 8 horas de juego, es largo y extenso con la mecanica del orignal juego.

Mi puntuacion para este CS es 7/10
